description: This is a plandefinition for AcousticTasksVoice

action

prefix: 1.8

title: Voice Disorders

description: Acoustic Tasks specific to voice cohort ​

priority: routine

Actions

-PrefixTitleDescription
*1.8 Task 1Prolonged vowel (1)Relax, take a deep breath, and sustain the sound “ah” for as long aspossible.
*1.8 Task 2Prolonged vowel (2)Chant the numbers 1 through 3 and say “ah” for 3-5 seconds.
*1.8 Task 3Sentences CAPE-VPlease read the sentences on your screen: 1. The blue spot is on the key again 2. How hard did he hit him? 3. We were away a year ago. 4. We eat eggs every easter. 5. My mama makes lemon muffins. 6. Peter will keep at the peak
*1.8 Task 4Connected speech passage Reading 'Rainbow passage'Please read the passage on your screen: When the sunlight strikes raindrops in the air, they act as a prism and form a rainbow. The rainbow is a division of white light into many beautiful colors. These take the shape of a long round arch, with its path high above, and its two ends apparently beyond the horizon.
*1.8 Task 5Pitch range & intensityUsing the sound 'e', glide from your lowest pitch possible to the highest pitch possible. Rest, take a breath and then glide from your highest pitch possible to the lowest pitch possible.

title: Acoustic Tasks Voice Cohort Protocol
description: This is a plandefinition for AcousticTasksVoice

action.title: Voice Disorders
action.description: Acoustic Tasks specific to voice cohort ​

action.title: Prolonged vowel (1)
action.description: Relax, take a deep breath, and sustain the sound “ah” for as long aspossible.

action.title: Prolonged vowel (2)
action.description: Chant the numbers 1 through 3 and say “ah” for 3-5 seconds.

action.title: Sentences CAPE-V
action.description:
Please read the sentences on your screen: 1. The blue spot is on the key again 2. How hard did he hit him? 3. We were
away a year ago. 4. We eat eggs every easter. 5. My mama makes lemon muffins. 6. Peter will keep at the peak

action.title: Connected speech passage Reading 'Rainbow passage'
action.description:
Please read the passage on your screen: 
When the sunlight strikes raindrops in the air, they act as a prism and form a rainbow. The rainbow is a division of white light into many beautiful colors. These take the shape of a long round arch, with its path high above, and its two ends apparently beyond the horizon.

action.title: Pitch range & intensity
action.description:
Using the sound
'e', glide from your
lowest pitch
possible to the
highest pitch
possible. Rest, take
a breath and then
glide from your
highest pitch
possible to the
lowest pitch
possible.
